channel.title: JAVA BEGGINNER TO INTERMEDIATE TUTORIALS *traitors*
channel.description:
I am at uni and in 3 weeks time i have a COMP160 paper end of semester test coming up.The paper is pretty much an introduction to java and covers all the basics. So for revision im going to write tutorials on Mopar to contribute to the community and get some revision done :D I will be covering
Introduction to Java Variables Methods Strings Arrays Objects Constructors Selection Repetition Static ArrayList Reading from files Events
and other stuff if i come accross it throughout my revision. I will update this thread as i go along.Feel free to contribute or point out if you think i have something wrong.Yea that's it pretty late at the moment so i wont dive into it now, just thought id post up to say im going to do something to motivate to actually do something :D should get some done this weekend

item.title: JAVA BEGGINNER TO INTERMEDIATE TUTORIALS *traitors*
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’m going to ask that you keep your revision to yourself.

Contrary to what seems to be popular belief amongst newcomers, this section wasn’t designed for people to re-invent the wheel (ie, rewrite tutorials on fundamentals). It’s for innovative discussion and questions, but not to rattle off text books in ‘your own words’ (read: change a word here, a word there, and pray that nobody picks up on it).

There are countless resources that can be found really quickly with a search engine; some are even referenced here. All of these resources do the language much more justice than the writings of a first year university student.

Read full topic
